sn40.4:3.1: 4 A Question About the Fourth Absorption
sn40.4:4.1: “‘They speak of this thing called the “fourth absorption”.
sn40.4:4.4: ‘It’s when, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
sn40.4:4.5: This is called the fourth absorption.’
sn40.4:4.6: And so … I was entering and remaining in the fourth absorption.
sn40.4:4.7: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by pleasure beset me.
sn40.4:5.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic powers and said:
sn40.4:5.3: Don’t neglect the fourth absorption, brahmin! Settle your mind in the fourth absorption; unify your mind and bring it to samādhi in the fourth absorption.’
sn40.4:5.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the fourth absorption.
sn40.4:5.5: So if anyone should be rightly called
sn40.4:5.6: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
